text: Erica Jong (née Mann; born March 26, 1942) is an American novelist, satirist, and poet. She is known for her 1973 novel Fear of Flying.www.poemhunter.com/erica-jong/biography The book became controversial for its claims towards female sexuality. According to Washington Post, it has sold more than 20 million copies worldwide. Jong was born in New York City. She studied at Barnard College and at Columbia University. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== * – official site * *What this woman wants – in-depth interview & profile in The Guardian, April 3, 1999 Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:American feminist writers Category:American novelists Category:American poets Category:Writers from New York City
title: Erica Jong
